SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/mock.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { mock } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' import { UserRejectedRequestError } from 'viem' const connector = mock({ accounts: [ '0xf39Fd6e51aad88F6F4ce6aB8827279cffFb92266', '0x70997970c51812dc3a010c7d01b50e0d17dc79c8', '0x3C44CdDdB6a900fa2b585dd299e03d12FA4293BC', ], features: { connectError: new UserRejectedRequestError(new Error('Failed to connect.')), reconnect: false, }, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using usePrepareTransactionRequest with Nonce Parameter - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to set the nonce of the transaction, which uniquely identifies it among others pending in the network. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/usePrepareTransactionRequest.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { usePrepareTransactionRequest } from 'wagmi' import { parseEther } from 'viem' function App() { const result = usePrepareTransactionRequest({ account: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', to: '0x70997970c51812dc3a010c7d01b50e0d17dc79c8', value: parseEther('1'), nonce: 5, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: useBalance with address parameter DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the `useBalance` hook with the `address` parameter. The `address` parameter specifies the Ethereum address for which to fetch the balance. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useBalance.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useBalance } from 'wagmi' import { mainnet } from 'wagmi/chains' function App() { const result = useBalance({ address: '0x4557B18E779944BFE9d78A672452331C186a9f48', // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: useCall with Nonce Parameter DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the usage of the `nonce` parameter within the `useCall` hook to specify the unique number identifying this transaction. The `nonce` parameter accepts a `number | undefined` value. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useCall.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useCall } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useCall({ account: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', data: '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2', nonce: 420, // [!code focus] to: '0x70997970c51812dc3a010c7d01b50e0d17dc79c8', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing VueQueryDevtools in Vue.js DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to import and use VueQueryDevtools in a Vue component. It demonstrates the basic setup required to include the devtools in a Vue application. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/guides/tanstack-query.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useEnsAvatar with Gateway URLs for CCIP-Read Requests DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify Universal Resolver gateways for resolving CCIP-Read requests through the ENS Universal Resolver Contract. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useEnsAvatar.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Block Number in useStorageAt Hook DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a block number when using the useStorageAt hook to retrieve storage data from a specific block. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useStorageAt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useStorageAt } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useStorageAt({ address: '0xFBA3912Ca04dd458c843e2EE08967fC04f3579c2', blockNumber: 16280770n, slot: '0x0', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: WalletConnect Relay URL Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure a custom relay URL for WalletConnect communications. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/walletConnect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { walletConnect } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' const connector = walletConnect({ projectId: '3fcc6bba6f1de962d911bb5b5c3dba68', relayUrl: 'wss://relay.walletconnect.org', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using connectors with useReconnect DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access and use the globally configured connectors with the useReconnect composable. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useReconnect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useEnsResolver with blockNumber Parameter DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify a blockNumber when fetching an ENS resolver, allowing retrieval of resolver information at a specific blockchain state. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEnsResolver.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useEnsResolver } from 'wagmi' import { normalize } from 'viem/ens' function App() { const result = useEnsResolver({ blockNumber: 17829139n, // [!code focus] name: normalize('wevm.eth'), }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Custom Name for HTTP Transport DESCRIPTION: Assigns a custom display name to the HTTP transport. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/transports/http.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const transport = http('https://foo-bar-baz.quiknode.pro/...', { name: 'Alchemy HTTP Provider', // [!code focus] }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing InjectedParameters Type DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import the TypeScript type definition for injected connector parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/injected.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { type InjectedParameters } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Asset Gateway Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating getEnsAvatar usage with custom IPFS gateway URL configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getEnsAvatar.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getEnsAvatar } from '@wagmi/core' import { normalize } from 'viem/ens' import { config } from './config' const ensAvatar = await getEnsAvatar(config, { assetGatewayUrls: { ipfs: 'https://cloudflare-ipfs.com', }, name: normalize('wevm.eth'), }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Scope Key in useProof Hook DESCRIPTION: This example elucidates how to use the 'scopeKey' parameter in the useProof hook. Scope keys define caching contexts so that hooks sharing a context can utilize the same cache, reducing redundant API calls. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useProof.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useProof } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useProof({ scopeKey: 'foo' // [!code focus] address: '0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000016', storageKeys: [ '0x4a932049252365b3eedbc5190e18949f2ec11f39d3bef2d259764799a1b27d99', ], }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using ethers.js Provider with wagmi chains DESCRIPTION: When using an ethers.js Provider with wagmi, you now need to provide your chains on the Provider instance. This example shows how to update the configuration to include defaultChains with the ethers provider. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_33 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` import { createClient, + defaultChains } from 'wagmi' import ethers from 'ethers' const client = createClient({ - provider: getDefaultProvider() + provider: Object.assign(getDefaultProvider(), { chains: defaultChains }) }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useClient with Chain ID Parameter DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use useClient with a specific chain ID parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useClient.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using getConnectorClient with ChainId Parameter DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify a particular chain ID when using getConnectorClient. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getConnectorClient.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getConnectorClient } from '@wagmi/core' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' import { config } from './config' const client = await getConnectorClient(config, { chainId: mainnet.id, // [!code focus] }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: OnConnect Callback Implementation DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates implementing the onConnect callback function with useAccountEffect. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useAccountEffect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useAccountEffect } from '@wagmi/vue' function App() { useAccountEffect({ onConnect(data) { console.log('Connected!', data) }, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Comparing Contract Interaction Code With and Without Wagmi CLI DESCRIPTION: Three code examples showing the evolution of contract interaction code: the diff view, the original implementation using basic wagmi hooks, and the simplified version using Wagmi CLI generated hooks. Demonstrates how Wagmi CLI reduces boilerplate and simplifies smart contract interactions. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/why.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useReadContract, useWriteContract } from 'wagmi' import { froggyFriendsAbi, froggyFriendsAddress } from './generated' function App() { const { data } = useReadContract({ abi: froggyFriendsAbi, address: froggyFriendsAddress, functionName: 'tokenURI', args: [123n], }) const { write } = useWriteContract() const onClick = React.useCallback(() => { write({ abi: froggyFriendsAbi, address: froggyFriendsAddress, functionName: 'mint', args: ['foo', 123n], }) }, [write]) } ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useReadFroggyFriends, useWriteFroggyFriends } from './generated' function App() { const { data } = useReadFroggyFriends({ functionName: 'tokenURI', args: [123n], }) const { write } = useWriteFroggyFriends() const onClick = React.useCallback(() => { write({ functionName: 'mint', args: ['foo', 123n], }) }, [write]) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Migrating Connection Status Flags from useConnect to useAccount in React DESCRIPTION: The connection status flags (isConnected, isConnecting, isReconnecting, isDisconnected) have been moved from useConnect to the useAccount hook. This snippet shows how to update your imports and hook usage to accommodate this breaking change. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/react/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` -import { useConnect } from 'wagmi' +import { useAccount } from 'wagmi' function App() { const { isConnected, isConnecting, isConnecting, isDisconnected - } = useConnect() + } = useAccount() } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using scopeKey Parameter with useEnsAddress DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use the scopeKey parameter to scope the cache to a specific context. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEnsAddress.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useEnsAddress } from 'wagmi' import { normalize } from 'viem/ens' function App() { const result = useEnsAddress({ name: normalize('wevm.eth'), scopeKey: 'foo', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Experimental EIP-5792 Features in wagmi 2.14.14 DESCRIPTION: Introduces waitForCallsStatus and useWaitForCallsStatus functions for EIP-5792 support. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/react/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ## 2.14.14 ### Patch Changes - [#4586](https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/pull/4586) [`edf47477b2f6385a1c3ae01d36a8498c47f30a0b`](https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/commit/edf47477b2f6385a1c3ae01d36a8498c47f30a0b) Thanks [@jxom](https://github.com/jxom)! - **Experimental (EIP-5792):** Added `waitForCallsStatus` + `useWaitForCallsStatus`. - Updated dependencies [[`edf47477b2f6385a1c3ae01d36a8498c47f30a0b`](https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/commit/edf47477b2f6385a1c3ae01d36a8498c47f30a0b), [`e944812ebc234a72c1417b77cff341166f5e0fef`](https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/commit/e944812ebc234a72c1417b77cff341166f5e0fef)]: - @wagmi/core@2.16.6 - @wagmi/connectors@5.7.10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useWalletClient with Specific Connector DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the useWalletClient hook with a specific connector, utilizing the useConnections hook to get available connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useWalletClient.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useConnections, useWalletClient } from 'wagmi' function App() { const connections = useConnections(config) const result = useWalletClient({ connector: connections[0]?.connector, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useChainId with Config Parameter DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the `useChainId` hook with an optional `config` parameter. This allows to specify a custom `Config` object instead of relying on the nearest `WagmiProvider`. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useChainId.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useChainId } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' // [!code focus] function App() { const chainId = useChainId({ config, // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Block Tag with useReadContract DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify a block tag like 'latest' or 'safe' for the contract function call. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useReadContract.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Connectors in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import connectors from the new @wagmi/connectors package in v2, replacing the old import method from individual entrypoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/guides/migrate-from-v1-to-v2.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { injected } from '@wagmi/connectors' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useCapabilities with a Connector Parameter - TSX DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates using a connector parameter in the useCapabilities hook to get the call statuses for specific connections, providing more control over the connections being used. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useCapabilities.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` const connections = useConnections() const result = useCapabilities({ connector: connections[0]?.connector, // [!code focus] }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Estimating Gas with Data Parameter DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates using the `data` parameter to pass a contract method call with encoded function data that needs gas estimation. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEstimateGas.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useEstimateGas } from 'wagmi' import { parseEther } from 'viem' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useEstimateGas({ data: '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2', // [!code focus] to: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', value: parseEther('0.01'), }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using getCallsStatus Action in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the getCallsStatus action to fetch the status of a call batch. It requires a configuration object and an id parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getCallsStatus.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getCallsStatus } from '@wagmi/core/experimental' import { config } from './config' const status = await getCallsStatus(config, { id: '0x1234567890abcdef', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing the useBytecode Hook - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet imports the `useBytecode` hook from the Wagmi library, which is used to retrieve bytecode at a specific address. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useBytecode.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useBytecode } from 'wagmi' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Wagmi v2 Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing Wagmi v2 and its peer dependencies using different package managers. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/guides/migrate-from-v1-to-v2.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm add wagmi viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/react-query ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install wagmi viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/react-query ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn add wagmi viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/react-query ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bun add wagmi viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/react-query ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MetaMask Dapp Metadata DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring the MetaMask connector with dapp metadata including name, URL, and icon URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/metaMask.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { metaMask } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' const connector = metaMask({ dappMetadata: { name: 'My Wagmi App', url: 'https://example.com', iconUrl: 'https://example.com/favicon.ico', } }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Token Retrieval with Chain ID DESCRIPTION: Example of getting token information while specifying a particular chain ID using mainnet. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getToken.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getToken } from '@wagmi/core' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' import { config } from './config' const token = await getToken(config, { address: '0x6B175474E89094C44Da98b954EedeAC495271d0F', chainId: mainnet.id, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using chainId Parameter with useEstimateFeesPerGas DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a specific blockchain chainId when using the useEstimateFeesPerGas hook. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEstimateFeesPerGas.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useEstimateFeesPerGas } from 'wagmi' import { mainnet } from 'wagmi/chains' // [!code focus] function App() { const result = useEstimateFeesPerGas({ chainId: mainnet.id, // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Errors with watchBlockNumber DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to handle errors that may occur when watching for block number changes using the onError callback. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchBlockNumber.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchBlockNumber } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const unwatch = watchBlockNumber(config, { onBlockNumber(blockNumber) { console.log('Block number changed!', blockNumber) }, onError(error) { console.error('Block number error', error) }, }) unwatch() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Raw Message Data with useVerifyMessage DESCRIPTION: Example of using useVerifyMessage hook with raw message data instead of UTF-8 representation. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useVerifyMessage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useVerifyMessage } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useVerifyMessage({ address: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', message: { raw: '0x68656c6c6f20776f726c64' } signature: '0x66edc32e2ab001213321ab7d959a2207fcef5190cc9abb6da5b0d2a8a9af2d4d2b0700e2c317c4106f337fd934fbbb0bf62efc8811a78603b33a8265d3b8f8cb1c', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Foundry Plugin Exclusions in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to exclude specific artifact files or patterns in the Foundry plugin configuration for Wagmi CLI. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/api/plugins/foundry.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from '@wagmi/cli' import { foundry } from '@wagmi/cli/plugins' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ foundry({ exclude: [ 'Common.sol/**', 'Components.sol/**', 'Script.sol/**', 'StdAssertions.sol/**', 'StdInvariant.sol/**', 'StdError.sol/**', 'StdCheats.sol/**', 'StdMath.sol/**', 'StdJson.sol/**', 'StdStorage.sol/**', 'StdUtils.sol/**', 'Vm.sol/**', 'console.sol/**', 'console2.sol/**', 'test.sol/**', '**.s.sol/*.json', '**.t.sol/*.json', ], }), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Usage of getBlockTransactionCount DESCRIPTION: Basic implementation example of getting block transaction count using the config. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getBlockTransactionCount.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getBlockTransactionCount } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const blockTransactionCount = await getBlockTransactionCount(config) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Block Tag with useStorageAt Hook DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use a block tag instead of a block number when retrieving storage data with the useStorageAt hook. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useStorageAt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useStorageAt } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useStorageAt({ address: '0xFBA3912Ca04dd458c843e2EE08967fC04f3579c2', blockTag: 'safe', slot: '0x0', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useEnsAvatar with Specific Block Number DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to fetch an ENS avatar at a specific blockchain block number. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useEnsAvatar.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Retry Count for unstable_connector Transport DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to set a custom retry count for the unstable_connector Transport when using the injected Connector. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/transports/unstable_connector.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { unstable_connector } from 'wagmi' import { injected } from 'wagmi/connectors' const transport = unstable_connector(injected, { retryCount: 5, // [!code focus] }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: ChainId Configuration DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to specify the `chainId` to use when fetching data with the `useReadContracts` hook. The chain ID is important for ensuring the contract interaction happens on the correct blockchain. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useReadContracts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useReadContracts } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useReadContracts({ contracts: [ { address: '0x1dfe7ca09e99d10835bf73044a23b73fc20623df', abi: mlootABI, functionName: 'getChest', args: [69], chainId: 1 // [!code hl] }, // ... ], }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Chain-Specific Avatar Retrieval DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to fetch ENS avatar for a specific chain using chainId SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getEnsAvatar.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getEnsAvatar } from '@wagmi/core' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' import { normalize } from 'viem/ens' import { config } from './config' const ensAvatar = await getEnsAvatar(config, { chainId: mainnet.id, name: normalize('wevm.eth'), }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: BlockTag Configuration DESCRIPTION: This example showcases how to configure the `blockTag` to read against with the `useReadContracts` hook. The `blockTag` allows specifying a symbolic name for a block (e.g., 'safe', 'finalized', 'latest'). SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useReadContracts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useReadContracts } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useReadContracts({ blockTag: 'safe', // [!code hl] contracts: [ { address: '0x1dfe7ca09e99d10835bf73044a23b73fc20623df', abi: mlootABI, functionName: 'getChest', args: [69] }, // ... ], }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring wagmi with unstable_connector Transport DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to set up a wagmi configuration using the unstable_connector Transport within a fallback Transport for the mainnet chain. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/transports/unstable_connector.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { createConfig, fallback, unstable_connector, // [!code hl] } from '{{packageName}}' import { mainnet } from '{{packageName}}/chains' export const config = createConfig({ chains: [mainnet], connectors: [injected()], transports: { [mainnet.id]: fallback([ unstable_connector(injected), // [!code hl] http('https://foo-bar-baz.quiknode.pro/...') ]) }, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing watchBlockNumber from @wagmi/core DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import the watchBlockNumber function from the @wagmi/core library. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchBlockNumber.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchBlockNumber } from '@wagmi/core' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using chainId Parameter with useVerifyTypedData DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use the chainId parameter when verifying a typed data signature, which is particularly useful for Smart Contract Accounts. The chain ID specifies which network to check for contract deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useVerifyTypedData.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { domain, types } from './data' import { useVerifyTypedData } from 'wagmi' import { mainnet } from 'wagmi/chains' function App() { const result = useVerifyTypedData({ chainId: mainnet.id, domain, types, message: { from: { name: 'Cow', wallet: '0xCD2a3d9F938E13CD947Ec05AbC7FE734Df8DD826', }, to: { name: 'Bob', wallet: '0xbBbBBBBbbBBBbbbBbbBbbbbBBbBbbbbBbBbbBBbB', }, contents: 'Hello, Bob!', }, primaryType: 'Mail', address: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', signature: '0x66edc32e2ab001213321ab7d959a2207fcef5190cc9abb6da5b0d2a8a9af2d4d2b0700e2c317c4106f337fd934fbbb0bf62efc8811a78603b33a8265d3b8f8cb1c', }) } ``` LANGUAGE: ts CODE: ``` // All properties on a domain are optional export const domain = { name: 'Ether Mail', version: '1', chainId: 1, verifyingContract: '0xCcCCccccCCCCcCCCCCCcCcCccCcCCCcCcccccccC', } as const // The named list of all type definitions export const types = { Person: [ { name: 'name', type: 'string' }, { name: 'wallet', type: 'address' }, ], Mail: [ { name: 'from', type: 'Person' }, { name: 'to', type: 'Person' }, { name: 'contents', type: 'string' }, ], } as const ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using getFeeHistory with blockNumber Parameter in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the getFeeHistory function with the optional blockNumber parameter to specify the highest block number of the requested range. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getFeeHistory.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getFeeHistory } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const feeHistory = await getFeeHistory(config, { blockCount: 4, blockNumber: 1551231n, rewardPercentiles: [25, 75], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useConnectorClient with Custom Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the useConnectorClient hook with a custom configuration imported from another file. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useConnectorClient.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useConnectorClient } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' // [!code focus] function App() { const result = useConnectorClient({ config, // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing useReconnect Hook in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import the `useReconnect` hook from the Wagmi library for use in a React component. It illustrates both the import statement and the component structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useReconnect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useReconnect } from 'wagmi' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using address Parameter with useBalance DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify the address parameter when using the useBalance composable. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useBalance.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing EstimateFeesPerGasReturnType DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import the return type definition for the estimateFeesPerGas function. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/estimateFeesPerGas.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { type EstimateFeesPerGasReturnType } from '@wagmi/core' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Address Retrieval for Block Explorer in Wagmi CLI DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the function for retrieving addresses from contract configurations in the blockExplorer plugin. This allows for flexible address handling across different chain IDs. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/api/plugins/blockExplorer.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from '@wagmi/cli' import { blockExplorer } from '@wagmi/cli/plugins' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ blockExplorer({ baseUrl: 'https://api.etherscan.io/v2/api', contracts: [ { name: 'Wagmigotchi', address: '0xecb504d39723b0be0e3a9aa33d646642d1051ee1', }, ], getAddress({ address }) { if (typeof address === 'string') return address return Object.values(address)[0] }, }), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Block Tag in useProof Hook DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the 'blockTag' parameter in the useProof hook. Block tags enable users to specify conditions like 'latest', 'earliest', or 'pending' for proof retrieval. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useProof.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useProof } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useProof({ address: '0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000016', blockTag: 'latest', // [!code focus] storageKeys: [ '0x4a932049252365b3eedbc5190e18949f2ec11f39d3bef2d259764799a1b27d99', ], }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Connectors with useSwitchAccount DESCRIPTION: A complete Vue component example demonstrating how to access the connectors array and use the switchAccount function to enable account switching. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useSwitchAccount.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Connect Return Type in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows the change in return type for the `connect` action from v1 to v2. The new type better reflects multiple accounts per connector. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/guides/migrate-from-v1-to-v2.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { GetAccountParameters, GetAccountReturnType } from '@wagmi/core' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Wagmi CLI with Custom Config File DESCRIPTION: Shows how to run the Wagmi CLI tool with a custom configuration file using the --config or -c option in the command line. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/config/configuring-cli.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` wagmi --config my-config.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: OnDisconnect Callback Implementation DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement the onDisconnect callback function with useAccountEffect. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useAccountEffect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useAccountEffect } from '@wagmi/vue' function App() { useAccountEffect({ onDisconnect() { console.log('Disconnected!') }, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Query Keys with Hooks DESCRIPTION: Example of accessing query keys using Wagmi hooks in a React component. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/guides/tanstack-query.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useBlock } from 'wagmi' function App() { const { queryKey } = useBlock() } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Chain ID for useEnsResolver Hook DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a chainId when using useEnsResolver to fetch from a particular blockchain network, specifically mainnet in this example. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEnsResolver.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useEnsResolver } from 'wagmi' import { mainnet } from 'wagmi/chains' // [!code focus] import { normalize } from 'viem/ens' function App() { const result = useEnsResolver({ chainId: mainnet.id, // [!code focus] name: normalize('wevm.eth'), }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useTransaction with blockTag Parameter DESCRIPTION: Example of fetching a transaction using a block tag and index. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useTransaction.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Query Keys with Imports DESCRIPTION: Example of accessing query keys using direct imports in vanilla JavaScript context. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/guides/tanstack-query.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getBlockQueryOptions } from 'wagmi/query' import { config } from './config' function perform() { const { queryKey } = getBlockQueryOptions(config, { chainId: config.state.chainId }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using blockTag parameter with useEnsName DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using the blockTag parameter to specify at which block state to fetch the ENS name. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEnsName.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useEnsName } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useEnsName({ address: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', blockTag: 'latest', // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: getStorageAt with Block Number DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify a block number when retrieving storage data. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getStorageAt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getStorageAt } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' await getStorageAt(config, { address: '0xFBA3912Ca04dd458c843e2EE08967fC04f3579c2', blockNumber: 16280770n, slot: '0x0', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Allowed Domains DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring allowed domains for Safe connector using regular expressions. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/safe.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { safe } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' const connector = safe({ allowedDomains: [/app.safe.global$/], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Typed Data with Chain ID in Wagmi Core DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to verify typed data signatures by specifying a chain ID. It's particularly useful when working with Smart Contract Accounts where verification needs to check if the contract was deployed. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/verifyTypedData.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { verifyTypedData } from '@wagmi/core' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' import { domain, types } from './data' import { config } from './config' const valid = await verifyTypedData(config, { chainId: mainnet.id, // [!code focus] domain, types, message: { from: { name: 'Cow', wallet: '0xCD2a3d9F938E13CD947Ec05AbC7FE734Df8DD826', }, to: { name: 'Bob', wallet: '0xbBbBBBBbbBBBbbbBbbBbbbbBBbBbbbbBbBbbBBbB', }, contents: 'Hello, Bob!', }, primaryType: 'Mail', address: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', signature: '0x66edc32e2ab001213321ab7d959a2207fcef5190cc9abb6da5b0d2a8a9af2d4d2b0700e2c317c4106f337fd934fbbb0bf62efc8811a78603b33a8265d3b8f8cb1c', }) // true ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // All properties on a domain are optional export const domain = { name: 'Ether Mail', version: '1', chainId: 1, verifyingContract: '0xCcCCccccCCCCcCCCCCCcCcCccCcCCCcCcccccccC', } as const // The named list of all type definitions export const types = { Person: [ { name: 'name', type: 'string' }, { name: 'wallet', type: 'address' }, ], Mail: [ { name: 'from', type: 'Person' }, { name: 'to', type: 'Person' }, { name: 'contents', type: 'string' }, ], } as const ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Simulating Contract Interaction with Nonce in Vue DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the useSimulateContract composable with a nonce parameter. It simulates a transferFrom function call on an ERC20 token contract with a specific transaction nonce. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useSimulateContract.md#2025-04-21_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Reconnection Behavior in WagmiPlugin DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set the 'reconnectOnMount' parameter when using WagmiPlugin. This controls whether previously connected connectors should reconnect on mount. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/WagmiPlugin.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { createApp } from 'vue' import { WagmiPlugin } from '@wagmi/vue' import App from './App.vue' import { config } from './config' createApp(App) .use(WagmiPlugin, { config, reconnectOnMount: false // [!code focus] }) .mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using emitMissed Parameter with watchBlocks DESCRIPTION: Shows how to enable the emitMissed option, which allows the watcher to emit notifications for blocks that may have been missed due to connection issues or timing. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchBlocks.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchBlocks } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const unwatch = watchBlocks(config, { emitMissed: true, // [!code focus] onBlock(block) { console.log('Block changed!', block) }, }) unwatch() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: useCall with Account Parameter DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the usage of the `account` parameter within the `useCall` hook to specify the account for the call. The `account` parameter can accept an `Account`, `Address`, or `undefined` value. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useCall.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useCall } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useCall({ account: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', // [!code focus] data: '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2', to: '0x70997970c51812dc3a010c7d01b50e0d17dc79c8', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using blockTag Parameter with useBalance DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a block tag when fetching a balance using the useBalance composable. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useBalance.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Estimating Gas with Gas Parameter DESCRIPTION: Describes how to set a predefined amount of gas for the transaction using the `gas` parameter in the `useEstimateGas` function. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEstimateGas.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useEstimateGas } from 'wagmi' import { parseEther, parseGwei } from 'viem' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useEstimateGas({ gas: parseGwei('20'), // [!code focus] to: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', value: parseEther('0.01'), }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic getStorageAt Usage DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates basic usage of getStorageAt to retrieve storage value from a contract address. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getStorageAt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getStorageAt } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' await getStorageAt(config, { address: '0xFBA3912Ca04dd458c843e2EE08967fC04f3579c2', slot: '0x0', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useBlockTransactionCount with config Parameter DESCRIPTION: Example of providing a custom config to the useBlockTransactionCount hook instead of using the nearest WagmiProvider. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useBlockTransactionCount.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useBlockTransactionCount } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useBlockTransactionCount({ config, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Scoping Cache with scopeKey in useBlockNumber (TSX) DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use 'scopeKey' to provide a contextual scope for caching, so similar hooks share the same cache. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useBlockNumber.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: TSX CODE: ``` import { useBlockNumber } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' // [!code focus] function App() { const result = useBlockNumber({ scopeKey: 'foo', // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useWaitForCallsStatus with Custom Config DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the useWaitForCallsStatus hook with a custom configuration object. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useWaitForCallsStatus.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useWaitForCallsStatus } from 'wagmi/experimental' import { config } from './config' // [!code focus] function App() { const result = useWaitForCallsStatus({ config, // [!code focus] id: '0x...', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Transaction Recipient Address DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify a recipient address when estimating gas for a transaction. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useEstimateGas.md#2025-04-21_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using IndexedDB as Storage DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use IndexedDB as the storage interface when creating a Storage object. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/createStorage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { createStorage } from '{{packageName}}' // Using IndexedDB via https://github.com/jakearchibald/idb-keyval import { del, get, set } from 'idb-keyval' const storage = createStorage({ storage: { async getItem(name) { return get(name) }, async setItem(name, value) { await set(name, value) }, async removeItem(name) { await del(name) }, }, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Raw Message Verification Example DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to verify a message using raw hexadecimal data SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/verifyMessage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { verifyMessage } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' await verifyMessage(config, { address: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', message: { raw: '0x68656c6c6f20776f726c64' } signature: '0x66edc32e2ab001213321ab7d959a2207fcef5190cc9abb6da5b0d2a8a9af2d4d2b0700e2c317c4106f337fd934fbbb0bf62efc8811a78603b33a8265d3b8f8cb1c', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: watchClient with onChange Handler DESCRIPTION: Illustrates implementation of the onChange callback function for handling client state changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchClient.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchClient } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const unwatch = watchClient(config, { onChange(client) { console.log('Client changed!', client) }, }) unwatch() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Custom Config with useSwitchChain DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use useSwitchChain with a custom configuration instead of the default WagmiProvider config. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useSwitchChain.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useSwitchChain } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useSwitchChain({ config, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useBlock to fetch block data by block number DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the `useBlock` hook with a specific block number to retrieve block information. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useBlock.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useBlock } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useBlock({ blockNumber: 42069n // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using scopeKey parameter with useEnsName DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the scopeKey parameter to scope the cache to a specific context for sharing between hooks. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEnsName.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useEnsName } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useEnsName({ address: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', scopeKey: 'foo', // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: useAccountEffect with onConnect callback DESCRIPTION: This example highlights the `onConnect` callback within the `useAccountEffect` hook. The callback receives data about the connected account(s) and executes custom logic upon connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useAccountEffect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useAccountEffect } from 'wagmi' function App() { useAccountEffect({ onConnect(data) { // [!code focus] console.log('Connected!', data) // [!code focus] }, // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Chain Property Usage in Vue Contract Simulation DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates basic usage of chain-specific properties like Celo's feeCurrency in a contract simulation using Wagmi Vue. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/guides/chain-properties.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { parseEther } from 'viem' import { useSimulateContract } from '@wagmi/vue' const result = useSimulateContract({ to: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', value: parseEther('0.01'), feeCurrency: '0x…' }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Timeout for WebSocket Transport DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates setting a custom timeout for async WebSocket requests in the Transport. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/transports/webSocket.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const transport = webSocket('wss://foo-bar-baz.quiknode.pro/...', { timeout: 60_000, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring useSendTransaction with Prepared Request in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the new usePrepareSendTransaction hook to prepare the configuration for useSendTransaction, improving UX and reducing potential pitfalls. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/react/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` import { usePrepareSendTransaction, useSendTransaction } from 'wagmi' +const { config } = usePrepareSendTransaction({ + request: { + to: 'moxey.eth', + value: parseEther('1'), + } +}) const { data } = useSendTransaction({ - request: { - to: 'moxey.eth', - value: parseEther('1') - } + ...config }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Declaring Config Interface in Wagmi DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to extend the Wagmi module in TypeScript to include a custom configuration interface. It establishes the types for the mainnet and sepolia chains. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useConfig.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { type Config } from 'wagmi' import { mainnet, sepolia } from 'wagmi/chains' declare module 'wagmi' { interface Register { config: Config } } // ---cut--- import { useConfig } from 'wagmi' function App() { const config = useConfig() // ^? } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: getStorageAt with Chain ID DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to specify a chain ID when retrieving storage data. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getStorageAt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getStorageAt } from '@wagmi/core' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' import { config } from './config' await getStorageAt(config, { chainId: mainnet.id, address: '0xFBA3912Ca04dd458c843e2EE08967fC04f3579c2', slot: '0x0', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Contracts in Etherscan Plugin Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify contracts for ABI fetching in the Etherscan plugin. Each contract requires a name and an address, which can be a single address or an object with chain-specific addresses. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/api/plugins/etherscan.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from '@wagmi/cli' import { etherscan } from '@wagmi/cli/plugins' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ etherscan({ apiKey: process.env.ETHERSCAN_API_KEY, chainId: 1, contracts: [ { name: 'Wagmigotchi', address: '0xecb504d39723b0be0e3a9aa33d646642d1051ee1', }, ], }), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Response Parsing Configuration - TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement custom response parsing logic for the fetched ABI data, including error handling for the API response. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/api/plugins/fetch.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from '@wagmi/cli' import { fetch } from '@wagmi/cli/plugins' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ fetch({ contracts: [ { name: 'Wagmigotchi', address: '0xecb504d39723b0be0e3a9aa33d646642d1051ee1', }, ], async parse({ response }) { const json = await response.json() if (json.status === '0') throw new Error(json.message) return json.result }, request(contract) { if (!contract.address) throw new Error('address is required') const address = typeof contract.address === 'string' ? contract.address : Object.values(contract.address)[0] return { url: `https://api.etherscan.io/api?module=contract&action=getabi&address=${address}`, } }, }), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Manual Installation of Wagmi and Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Commands for manually installing Wagmi and its dependencies (viem and @tanstack/vue-query) using different package managers. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/getting-started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm add @wagmi/vue viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/vue-query ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install @wagmi/vue viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/vue-query ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn add @wagmi/vue viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/vue-query ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bun add @wagmi/vue viem@{{viemVersion}} @tanstack/vue-query ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using fetchTransaction in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use the new fetchTransaction action to retrieve transaction details by providing a transaction hash. This action fetches and returns the transaction data. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { fetchTransaction } from "@wagmi/core"; const transaction = await fetchTransaction({ hash: "0x5c504ed432cb51138bcf09aa5e8a410dd4a1e204ef84bfed1be16dfba1b22060", }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Hardhat Plugin Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example of basic plugin configuration in Wagmi CLI config file. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/api/plugins/hardhat.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from '@wagmi/cli' import { hardhat } from '@wagmi/cli/plugins' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ hardhat({ project: '../hello_hardhat', }), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useTransactionCount with Block Tag Parameter DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates using the useTransactionCount hook with a block tag to get the transaction count at a specific state of the blockchain. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useTransactionCount.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useTransactionCount } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useTransactionCount({ address: '0x4557B18E779944BFE9d78A672452331C186a9f48', blockTag: 'latest', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using polling in useWatchPendingTransactions DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to enable polling for checking new pending transactions instead of using WebSocket subscriptions. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/coinbaseWallet.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { coinbaseWallet } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' const connector = coinbaseWallet({ appName: 'My Wagmi App', preference: 'smartWalletOnly', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching ENS Name with Chain ID in Vue.js DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the useEnsName composable with a specific chain ID to fetch the ENS name from a particular network. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useEnsName.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useConnectorClient with ChainId Parameter DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify a chainId when using the useConnectorClient composable. The cache is stored at ~/.wagmi-cli/plugins/fetch/cache/. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/api/plugins/fetch.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from '@wagmi/cli' import { fetch } from '@wagmi/cli/plugins' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ fetch({ contracts: [ { name: 'wagmigotchi', address: '0xecb504d39723b0be0e3a9aa33d646642d1051ee1', }, ], getCacheKey({ contract }) { if (typeof contract.address === 'string') return `${name}:${contract.address}` return `${name}:${JSON.stringify(contract.address)}` }, request(contract) { if (!contract.address) throw new Error('address is required') const address = typeof contract.address === 'string' ? contract.address : Object.values(contract.address)[0] return { url: `https://api.etherscan.io/api?module=contract&action=getabi&address=${address}`, } }, }), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Coin Type for ENS Address Lookup DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set a coin type when fetching an ENS address using useEnsAddress. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useTransactionReceipt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useTransactionReceipt } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useTransactionReceipt({ hash: '0x4ca7ee652d57678f26e887c149ab0735f41de37bcad58c9f6d3ed5824f15b74d', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using the chainId Parameter - TSX DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the `chainId` parameter in the `useBytecode` hook to specify the network's chain ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/cli/getting-started.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` pnpm wagmi generate ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npx wagmi generate ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` yarn wagmi generate ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bun wagmi generate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Selecting Specific Connector for Call Status DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use a specific blockchain connector when retrieving call batch status, useful for multi-wallet or multi-chain applications SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useCallsStatus.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useCallsStatus, useConnections } from 'wagmi/experimental' import { config } from './config' function App() { const connections = useConnections() const result = useCallsStatus({ connector: connections[0]?.connector, id: '0x...', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Prefetching Query Data on User Events with wagmi DESCRIPTION: Shows how to prefetch block data when a user hovers over or focuses on a link, improving perceived performance. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/guides/tanstack-query.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { Link } from 'next/link' import { getBlockQueryOptions } from 'wagmi' function App() { const config = useConfig() const chainId = useChainId() // 1. Set up a function to prefetch the block data. const prefetch = () => queryClient.prefetchQuery(getBlockQueryOptions(config, { chainId })) return ( Block details ) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useEnsText with Custom Config DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use useEnsText with a custom configuration object instead of the default from WagmiProvider. Makes the parameter mandatory to work with Alchemy's API services. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchAccount.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchAccount } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const unwatch = watchAccount(config, { onChange(account) { console.log('Account changed!', account) }, }) unwatch() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Gas Price for Legacy Transactions DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set the gasPrice parameter for legacy transactions. The price is specified in Gwei using parseGwei and applies only to legacy transaction types. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useSimulateContract.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useSimulateContract } from 'wagmi' import { parseGwei } from 'viem' import { abi } from './abi' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useSimulateContract({ abi, address: '0x6b175474e89094c44da98b954eedeac495271d0f', functionName: 'transferFrom', args: [ '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', '0xA0Cf798816D4b9b9866b5330EEa46a18382f251e', 123n, ], gasPrice: parseGwei('20'), }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Token Retrieval with Format Units DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify format units when retrieving token information. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getToken.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getToken } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const token = getToken(config, { address: '0x6B175474E89094C44Da98b954EedeAC495271d0F', formatUnits: 'ether', }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Wagmi Composables in Vue Component DESCRIPTION: Example Vue component demonstrating auto-imported Wagmi composables usage. Shows how to access account information without explicit imports. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/Nuxt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Usage of useEnsAvatar with ENS Name Normalization DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the useEnsAvatar composable with a normalized ENS name. Normalization is important as ENS names prohibit certain characters and have validation rules. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useEnsAvatar.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing RPC URLs from Chain Objects DESCRIPTION: Update pattern for accessing RPC URLs directly from chain objects after the removal of separate RPC URL exports for providers. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` - import { alchemyRpcUrls, infuraRpcUrls, publicRpcUrls } from '@wagmi/core' + import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' -const mainnetAlchemyRpcUrl = alchemyRpcUrls.mainnet -const mainnetInfuraRpcUrl = infuraRpcUrls.mainnet -const mainnetOptimismRpcUrl = publicRpcUrls.mainnet +const mainnetAlchemyRpcUrl = mainnet.rpcUrls.alchemy +const mainnetInfuraRpcUrl = mainnet.rpcUrls.infura +const mainnetOptimismRpcUrl = mainnet.rpcUrls.optimism ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Consolidating writeContract Parameters in wagmi DESCRIPTION: The writeContract function parameters have been consolidated into a singular config parameter, similar to the readContract change. This provides a more consistent API across the library. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` writeContract( { addressOrName: "0xecb504d39723b0be0e3a9aa33d646642d1051ee1", contractInterface: wagmigotchiABI, }, "feed", ); ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` readContract({ addressOrName: "0xecb504d39723b0be0e3a9aa33d646642d1051ee1", contractInterface: wagmigotchiABI, functionName: "feed", }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useConnectorClient with a Specific Chain ID DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a chain ID when using the useConnectorClient hook. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useConnectorClient.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useConnectorClient } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useConnectorClient({ chainId: mainnet.id, // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: useFeeHistory with blockTag parameter DESCRIPTION: This code illustrates the usage of the `blockTag` parameter in the `useFeeHistory` hook. The `blockTag` parameter defines the block tag of the highest number block of the requested range, influencing which block is used as the end of the range for fetching gas history. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useFeeHistory.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useFeeHistory } from 'wagmi' function App() { const result = useFeeHistory({ blockCount: 4, blockTag: 'safe', // [!code focus] rewardPercentiles: [25, 75] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Usage with Cache Time Parameter DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use getBlockTransactionCount with a custom cache time parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getBlockTransactionCount.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getBlockTransactionCount } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const blockTransactionCount = await getBlockTransactionCount(config, { cacheTime: 4_000, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using sendTransaction to send Ethereum DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the sendTransaction function to send 0.01 ETH to a specific address. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/sendTransaction.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { sendTransaction } from '@wagmi/core' import { parseEther } from 'viem' import { config } from './config' const result = await sendTransaction(config, { to: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', value: parseEther('0.01'), }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using scopeKey Parameter in useVerifyMessage DESCRIPTION: Example of using the scopeKey parameter to scope the cache in useVerifyMessage hook. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useVerifyMessage.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useVerifyMessage } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useVerifyMessage({ scopeKey: 'foo' address: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', message: 'hello world', signature: '0x66edc32e2ab001213321ab7d959a2207fcef5190cc9abb6da5b0d2a8a9af2d4d2b0700e2c317c4106f337fd934fbbb0bf62efc8811a78603b33a8265d3b8f8cb1c', }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Deserialize Function with bigint Support DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the deserialize function to parse a JSON string containing a bigint value, which would normally not be supported by standard JSON.parse(). SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/utilities/deserialize.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { deserialize } from '{{packageName}}' const result = deserialize('{"foo":"wagmi","bar":{"__type":"bigint","value":"123"}}') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: watchConnections with onChange Handler DESCRIPTION: Example showing the onChange callback implementation in watchConnections with focused lines highlighting the handler function. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchConnections.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchConnections } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const unwatch = watchConnections(config, { onChange(data) { console.log('Connections changed!', data) }, }) unwatch() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using config parameter with useEnsName DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates passing a custom configuration to the useEnsName hook instead of using the nearest WagmiProvider. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEnsName.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useEnsName } from 'wagmi' import { normalize } from 'viem/ens' import { config } from './config' // [!code focus] function App() { const result = useEnsName({ address: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', config, // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using a Custom Config DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to provide a custom config to the useTransactionReceipt composable instead of using the default from WagmiPlugin. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useTransactionReceipt.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Polling Interval Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the polling interval for waitForCallsStatus. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/waitForCallsStatus.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { waitForCallsStatus } from '@wagmi/core/experimental' import { config } from './config' const status = await waitForCallsStatus(config, { id: '0x1234567890abcdef', pollingInterval: 1_000, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Custom Config with useShowCallsStatus Hook in React DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to use a custom configuration with the useShowCallsStatus hook in a React component. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useShowCallsStatus.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useShowCallsStatus } from 'wagmi/experimental' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useShowCallsStatus({ config, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: QR Modal Options Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring the QR modal display options for WalletConnect. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/walletConnect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { walletConnect } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' const connector = walletConnect({ projectId: '3fcc6bba6f1de962d911bb5b5c3dba68', qrModalOptions: { themeMode: 'dark', }, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useTransactionReceipt with Scope Key DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use useTransactionReceipt hook with a scope key for cache control. } from './config' function App() { const result = useTransactionReceipt({ scopeKey: 'foo' hash: '0x4ca7ee652d57678f26e887c149ab0735f41de37bcad58c9f6d3ed5824f15b74d', }) } ``` useConnections } from 'wagmi' import { config } from './config' function App() { const connections = useConnections({ config, }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Chain ID Configuration DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to specify a specific chain ID for transaction monitoring SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchPendingTransactions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchPendingTransactions } from '@wagmi/core' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' import { config } from './config' const unwatch = watchPendingTransactions(config, { chainId: mainnet.id, onTransactions(transactions) { console.log('New transactions!', transactions) }, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Async Provider Injection DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure the shimAsyncInject parameter for handling asynchronously injected providers. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/shared/connectors/injected.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { injected } from '{{connectorsPackageName}}' const connector = injected({ unstable_shimAsyncInject: 2_000, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using getFeeHistory with chainId Parameter in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the getFeeHistory function with the optional chainId parameter to specify the chain ID for fetching data. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/getFeeHistory.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { getFeeHistory } from '@wagmi/core' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' import { config } from './config' const feeHistory = await getFeeHistory(config, { blockCount: 4, chainId: mainnet.id, rewardPercentiles: [25, 75], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Block Data with wagmi Query Options DESCRIPTION: Shows how to fetch block data imperatively using TanStack Query's fetchQuery method with wagmi's getBlockQueryOptions. This approach allows retrieving blockchain data outside of React components while leveraging the query cache. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/guides/tanstack-query.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { getBlockQueryOptions } from 'wagmi' import { queryClient } from './app' import { config } from './config' export async function fetchBlockData() { return queryClient.fetchQuery( getBlockQueryOptions(config, { chainId: config.state.chainId, } )) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: useFeeHistory with chainId parameter DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the `chainId` parameter with the `useFeeHistory` hook. The `chainId` parameter specifies the ID of the chain to use when fetching gas data, allowing the hook to target a specific blockchain. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useFeeHistory.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useFeeHistory } from 'wagmi' import { mainnet } from '@wagmi/core/chains' function App() { const result = useFeeHistory({ blockCount: 4, chainId: mainnet.id, // [!code focus] rewardPercentiles: [25, 75] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using useWaitForCallsStatus with Timeout DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the useWaitForCallsStatus hook with a custom timeout value. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useWaitForCallsStatus.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useWaitForCallsStatus } from '@wagmi/core' import { config } from './config' const status = await useWaitForCallsStatus({ id: '0x1234567890abcdef', timeout: 10_000, // [!code focus] }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing readContract Function DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to import the readContract function from @wagmi/core library. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` - import { etherscanBlockExplorers } from '@wagmi/core' + import { mainnet, polygon, optimism } from '@wagmi/core/chains' -const mainnetEtherscanBlockExplorer = etherscanBlockExplorers.mainnet -const polygonEtherscanBlockExplorer = etherscanBlockExplorers.polygon -const optimismEtherscanBlockExplorer = etherscanBlockExplorers.optimism +const mainnetEtherscanBlockExplorer = mainnet.blockExplorer +const polygonEtherscanBlockExplorer = polygon.blockExplorer +const optimismEtherscanBlockExplorer = optimism.blockExplorer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Import Example DESCRIPTION: Shows how to import the watchPendingTransactions function SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/watchPendingTransactions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { watchPendingTransactions } from '@wagmi/core' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using scopeKey Parameter with useBalance DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the scopeKey parameter to scope the cache to a specific context. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/vue/api/composables/useEnsAddress.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: vue CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SendCalls with Connector DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use sendCalls with a specific connector configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/core/api/actions/sendCalls.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { parseEther } from 'viem' import { getConnections } from '@wagmi/core' import { sendCalls } from '@wagmi/core/experimental' import { config } from './config' const connections = getConnections(config) const id = await sendCalls(config, { calls: [ { to: '0x70997970c51812dc3a010c7d01b50e0d17dc79c8', value: parseEther('1') }, { data: '0xdeadbeef', to: '0xa5cc3c03994DB5b0d9A5eEdD10CabaB0813678AC', }, ], connector: connections[0]?.connector, }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: useBalance with chainId parameter DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the `useBalance` hook with the `chainId` parameter. The `chainId` parameter specifies the chain to use when fetching data. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useBalance.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { useBalance } from 'wagmi' import { mainnet } from 'wagmi/chains' // [!code focus] function App() { const result = useBalance({ address: '0x4557B18E779944BFE9d78A672452331C186a9f48', chainId: mainnet.id, // [!code focus] }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Dependencies in package.json for wagmi DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an update to the dependencies in the package.json file, adding 'abitype' to ensure correct type shipping. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/packages/react/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "dependencies": { "abitype": "" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Estimating Gas with Gas Price Parameter DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the implementation of the `gasPrice` parameter to set the price per gas for legacy transactions within the `useEstimateGas` hook. SOURCE: https://github.com/wevm/wagmi/blob/main/site/react/api/hooks/useEstimateGas.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { useEstimateGas } from 'wagmi' import { parseEther, parseGwei } from 'viem' import { config } from './config' function App() { const result = useEstimateGas({ gasPrice: parseGwei('20'), // [!code focus] to: '0xd2135CfB216b74109775236E36d4b433F1DF507B', value: parseEther('0.01'), }) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using the scopeKey Parameter DESCRIPTION: Example of using the scopeKey parameter to scope the cache context when using the useTransactionReceipt composable.
